clinical_study.brief_title: Satisfaction of Hospitalized Diabetic Patients Using a Continuous Glucose Monitoring System
clinical_study.official_title: Satisfaction of Using a Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to Monitor Interstitial Fluid Glucose Level in Hospitalized Insulin-dependent Diabetic Patients Treated Using a Portable Sub-cutaneous Pump

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to establish whether routine usage of the FreeStyle Libre™ system (Abbott) improves satisfaction and quality of sleep in patients hospitalized for poor glycemic control with an indication for external insulin pump treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction of patient-determined hospital care at discharge in the two groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge from hospital; maximum Day 5

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction concerning treatment for their diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge from hospital; maximum Day 5
at each day of hospitalization and discharge; maximum Day 5

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction of nursing staff concerning care of patient
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at end of study; maximum Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: visual analogue scale response to 5 quesions

secondary_outcome.measure: Time taken by nurse to measure circulating glucose level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily over length of hospitalization until maximum Day 5

secondary_outcome.measure: Time necessary to achieve satisfactory equilibrium using insulin pump
Number of glucose readings above 2g/l and below 0.80g/l over the hospital stay
Number of hypoglycmic events with the corresponding glucose level

arm_group.description: Glucose level tested by continuous monitoring device
Glucose level tested on glucose monitor using standard finger prick

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has given their free and informed consent
- The patient must be insured or the beneficiary of an insurance policy
- The patient is aged at least 18 years and less than 75 years old.
- Patients have a BMI between 18 and 40kg/m2
- Diabetic patient admitted for glycemic instability with indication for treatment using an external insulin pump but otherwise in a stable clinical state
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject is participating in another study
- The subject is in an exclusion period determined by a previous study
- The patients is under judicial protection or state guardianship
- The subject refuses to sign the consent form
- It proves impossible to give the subject clear information.
- The patient is pregnant, parturient or breastfeeding
- The patient is clinically unstable
- BMI less than 18 or over 40
- Existence of a severe rapidly progressive ischemic retinopathy or proliferative retinopathy.
- Serious psychiatric problems
- Chronic cutaneous infection
